results.title: Prelude to fractions
results.brief_description: Made for the Mathematics Curriculum Committee with the coperation of the staff and pupils of Boroondarra North Primary School. Shows children aged about 10 years in the classroom, playing with blocks and shapes, to learn how parts make up a whole and how this relates to fractions. The narrator is the teacher.

results.title: Prelude
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Orchestra Series”.
The Orchestra series describes the evolution of the modern symphony orchestra from its beginnings in the 17th century to the present. Part One traces the beginnings of the orchestra in the wood-wind bands used for open air music. It shows how the development of opera in the 16th century prepared the way for musical interludes of descriptive and dramatic power, and the program includes a passage from Monteverdi’s “Tancredi and Clorinda”.

results.title: Prehistoric times the world before man
results.brief_description: Diagrams, actual fossil remains and models are used to recrate the earth in its presumed form during the two-billion year period prior to the coming of man. Explains the most important geological and biological developments of the five great geological eras - Archeozoic, Proterozoic, Paleozoic, Mesozoic and Cenozoic.

results.title: Pregnancy after 35
results.creator_credit: Gwen Brown, Alvin Fiering and Polymorph Films
results.brief_description: Uses interviews with middle aged mothers and information from Carole S. McCauley’s book, to allay the fears of women contemplating pregnancy after 35. Shows emotional and physical reactions to pregnancy at this age, discusses Down’s syndrome and demonstrates an amniocentesis which test foetal chromosomes.

results.title: Preemies : the price tag (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows how premature babies in the intensive care unit of a large hospital are kept alive. Most have underdeveloped lungs and have resulting breathing and feeding problems. This raises the issue of the tremendous costs involved and the fact that many babies develop handicaps as a direct result of the intensive care they are given. These can include deafness, blindness, cerebral palsy and mental retardation. Both parents and doctors express opinions on these issues.

results.title: Prediction problem
results.creator_credit: Katie Jennings and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Fire on the rim”.
Careful planning with technological innovation can minimise the damage and death caused by seismic activity. The education of peoples in lands around the “ring of fire” also assists in avoiding unnecessary disaster. Although scientists can make intelligent guesses about the movement of the earth, the predicition of earthquakes and eruptions remains an imperfect art. The study of historical evidence coupled with intensive research around the Pacific Rim, is helping to gain a clearer picture of the problem.

results.title: Predator (10th Anniversary Double Pack)
results.creator_credit: Joel Silver and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Predator: Dutch, (Arnold Schwarzenneger) a military special forces operative, is sent on a covert rescue mission to a Latin American country. After fighting off a team of local guerrillas, Dutch’s own team start to get picked off, by a deadly inhuman force. Deep in the rainforest the camouflaged predator is soon on Dutch’s tail - whose skills and deadly cunning make him a worthy match for the stealth of the monster. “Predator” is an action movie with traits typical of the science fiction/action genre: throwaway lines, fast moving suspense sequences and insurmountable odds for the hero. “Predator 2”: The setting for the sequel is the urban jungle of downtown LA. A detective and his crew are baffled by a series of gruesome murders of local drug dealers. An FBI officer warns the team off further investigation, which of course only strengthens the resolve of the team. When part of his own posse is murdered, the detective uncovers the awful truth - the monstrous villain of the original film is back. Like the original, the sequel relies heavily on special effects and action to entertain, this time with Danny Glover in the lead role.

results.title: Precision echo sounding
results.creator_credit: R.K. Neilson Baxter and Basic Films
results.brief_description: Covers in detail the method of making sea surveys using precision echo sounding, contrasting old-fashioned methods with the remarkable accuracy and efficiency of echo-sounding.
